result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Brandon J Fryar

defendant.name: Fryar, Brandon J
defendant.address: 1501 Lily Lake Lane, c/o Karl Herminath, Pickerel, WI 54465

records.addlTxt: No possession or consumption of alcohol, no entry into any bars or taverns.

02:49 PM Defendant Brandon J Fryar in court with attorney Lindsay L Erickson.  Alexander Paul Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called 22CF36 and 22CF48. State will proceed with 22CF36 calls Det. Sgt. Darrell Wilson. Sworn in 2:50 PM. State directs. Proper identification of defendant, 2:56 PM. Cross examination by Attorney Erickson, 2:56 PM. No further witnesses. Court finds probable cause, binds over for trial, information has been filed. Erickson has received information, waives further reading and enters NG pleas. Court accepts pleas, will have set for JT and continues bond. Court now calls 22CF48. State calls Deputy John Doane. Sworn in 3:02 PM. State directs. Proper identification of defendant, 3:06 PM. Cross-examination by Attorney Erickson, 3:06 PM. Objection by state, asks for deputy to have a copy of the complaint if attorney is going to have deputy refer to it, court instructs Erickson to ask question. State re-directs, 3:11 PM. Deputy excused, 3:11 PM. State calls CO Dillon West as witness. Sworn in, 3:12 PM. State directs. Cross-examination by Attorney Erickson, 3:16 PM. No further witnesses. Court finds probable cause, binds over for trial. State indicates there are some typos in the information and would like to file an amended information. Discussion regarding amending count 2. Erickson indicates if amended information would have been filed previous then may have waived PH, will enter NG pleas. Court accepts plea and instructs state to file amended information today. State will do so. Court continues bond on both cases and will have set for JT. Back on the record, 3:39 PM. Called both cases. Erickson wanted to address bond modification to allow him to go out of county with grandfather for medical appointments and would like to address no tavern condition as his parents live behind the bar that they own. State does not object amending bond conditions. Court - will delete must remain in FC condition but will not remove the no tavern condition.
No possession or consumption of alcohol, no entry into any bars or taverns, must remain in Forest County.

ADDRESS INFO for Brandon J Fryar
Current: 1501 Lily Lake Lane, c/o Karl Herminath, Pickerel, WI 54465 United States  (Effective: 03-09-2022)
Prior: 1775 Cavour Ave, Wabeno, WI 54566
Preliminary hearing on March 30, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

08:48 AM Defendant Brandon J Fryar in court with attorney Lindsay L Erickson.  Defendant Brandon J Fryar in custody and appears via video from FOSO.  Alexander Paul Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Brandon J Fryar appeared by video means with Attorney. Erickson and Fryar have complaint, waives reading of it, requests PH but would like to be heard on bond prior to making the decision to waive time limits for it. Erickson - bond - asks for either a signature bond or that the $10,000.00 cash that he posted on another matter that is not yet filed be tranferred to this case for stated reasons. State - bond - moves to dismiss bond on FOSO Incident # and use for this case with the permission of the poster (defendant's grandfather). The poster is in the same room as Atty Erickson and has agreed to that, Court would like it in writing. Court asks State if they will be moving to forfeit $12,000.00 that is posted on two other matters. State - asking that that bond be dismissed and set bond on this matter at $10,000.00 cash and transfer that money. Court - bond - $10,000.00 cash bond, no possession or consumption of alcohol, no entry into any bars or taverns, must remain in Forest County, $10,000.00 cash from FOSO Incident #22-1679/1763 can be refunded to poster. Court also calls 22CF48 and holds an initial appearance on that matter (was originally set for 4/5/22). Fryar and Erickson have complaint, waives reading of it, set for PH. Court sets both matters for PH on 3/30/22 at 2:30 PM. Erickson will scan a letter of approval from the poster to move the $10,000.00 cash that was posted on FOSO Incident #22-1679/1763 to 22CF36, Clerk will await that letter. Clerk instructed to take FOSO Incident #22-1679/1763 off of the 3/22/22 calendar for an INIT as that bond has now be dismissed, State to file complaint with either a summons or a warrant on that matter when they make that decision. Adjourned at 9:02 AM.
Initial appearance on March 30, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Bail/bond hearing on March 9, 2022 at 08:45 am.
